note.value: Previously unknown hexameters of mythological content on the childhood of Dionysus. The presence of proparoxytone words at the end of the verses, of spondaic verses, and of consecutive spondees rules out the attribution of this work to a follower of the Nonnus of Panopolis school and of his "modern style." The style is rather archaic, as in the uninterrupted reuse of Homeric formulae at the beginning and end of the verses
Bibliography: Rossetto 2021 ; Rossetto, et al. ; Rossetto 2023b
